body.p:
Lex. April 28th /62
Govr Magoffin
D Sir=

About a year ago you respited for twelve months ago a fine for fifty dollars against Isaac Rumsey imposed by the Lexington city court on him for carrying a pistol. The judgment was rendered on confession. At the last February Term of the Fayette Circuit Court he was Tried for shooting at Otho Reynolds, (that being the time at which the pistol was in his possession for which the $50, fine was imposed) & on a fearing hearing of the case he was promptly acquited by the Jury on the grounds of self-defense. His right to carry this pistol & the necessity for it was clearly shown on the main trial we were his comrades & have no doubt as to the propriety
of your Excellency releasing Rumsey from the fine.

We postponed urging the matter untill the Trial of the main case, as we thought that would determine whether or not you ought to interpose further. Rumsey is a peaceable inoffensive man & it was only under circumstances of great aggrevation that he was compelled to arm himself in selfdefence. If desired he can provide any number of persons to certify to the above facts

Respectully
your obt sevt
James B Beck
In addition to the foregoing I state that Mr Rumsey is a poor man, dependent on his daily loabor for support

Remitted
B. M.
April 28th
made out
Lexington City Ct
Isaac Rumsey
send to Beck & Hunt at Lexington
